title.raw: 《項羽本紀》 Annals of Xiang Yu

sentences.zh: 項籍者，下相人也，字羽。

translations.text: Xiang Ji was a Xiagiang man, courtesy name Yu.

sentences.zh: 初起時，年二十四。

translations.text: When he first rose, aged twenty-four.

sentences.zh: 其季父項梁，梁父即楚將項燕，為秦將王翦所戮者也。

translations.text: His uncle Xiang Liang, Liang's father was Chu general Xiang Yan, who was executed by Qin general Wang Jian.

sentences.zh: 項氏世世為楚將，封於項，故姓項氏。

translations.text: Xiang clan generation after generation were Chu generals, enfeoffed at Xiang, therefore surnamed Xiang clan.

Xiang Ji was a Xiagiang man, courtesy name Yu. When he first rose, aged twenty-four. His uncle Xiang Liang, Liang's father was Chu general Xiang Yan, who was executed by Qin general Wang Jian. Xiang clan generation after generation were Chu generals, enfeoffed at Xiang, therefore surnamed Xiang clan.

sentences.zh: 項籍少時，學書不成，去學劍，又不成。

translations.text: Xiang Ji in youth, studied writing but did not succeed, left to study sword, again did not succeed.

sentences.zh: 項梁怒之。

translations.text: Xiang Liang angered him.

sentences.zh: 籍曰：「書足以記名姓而已。

translations.text: Ji said: 'Writing suffices to record names only.

sentences.zh: 劍一人敵，不足學，學萬人敵。」

translations.text: Sword one man enemy, not worth learning, learn ten thousand man enemy.'

sentences.zh: 於是項梁乃教籍兵法，籍大喜，略知其意，又不肯竟學。

translations.text: Thereupon Xiang Liang taught Ji military tactics, Ji greatly pleased, roughly knew its meaning, but again unwilling to finish learning.

sentences.zh: 項梁嘗有櫟陽逮，乃請蘄獄掾曹咎書抵櫟陽獄掾司馬欣，以故事得已。

translations.text: Xiang Liang once had Queyang arrest, then requested Qi prison clerk Cao Jiu write to Queyang prison clerk Sima Xin, to use precedent got released.

sentences.zh: 項梁殺人，與籍避仇於吳中。

translations.text: Xiang Liang killed person, with Ji avoided enmity in Wu Zhong.

sentences.zh: 吳中賢士大夫皆出項梁下。

translations.text: Wu Zhong worthy scholars all came out under Xiang Liang.

sentences.zh: 每吳中有大繇役及喪，項梁常為主辦，陰以兵法部勒賓客及子弟，以是知其能。

translations.text: Whenever Wu Zhong had great labor service or funerals, Xiang Liang often acted as main manager, secretly used military tactics to organize guests and younger brothers, with this knew his ability.

sentences.zh: 秦始皇帝游會稽，渡浙江，梁與籍俱觀。

translations.text: Qin First Emperor toured Kuaiji, crossed Zhejiang, Liang with Ji both watched.

sentences.zh: 籍曰：「彼可取而代也。」

translations.text: Ji said: 'That can be taken and replaced.'

sentences.zh: 梁掩其口，曰：「毋妄言，族矣！」

translations.text: Liang covered his mouth, said: 'Do not reckless speak, clan exterminated!'

sentences.zh: 梁以此奇籍。

translations.text: Liang with this considered Ji extraordinary.

sentences.zh: 籍長八尺餘，力能扛鼎，才氣過人，雖吳中子弟皆已憚籍矣。

translations.text: Ji grew eight chi plus, strength could lift tripod, talent spirit surpassed people, though Wu Zhong younger brothers all already feared Ji.

Xiang Ji in youth, studied writing but did not succeed, left to study sword, again did not succeed. Xiang Liang angered him. Ji said: 'Writing suffices to record names only. Sword one man enemy, not worth learning, learn ten thousand man enemy.' Thereupon Xiang Liang taught Ji military tactics, Ji greatly pleased, roughly knew its meaning, but again unwilling to finish learning. Xiang Liang once had Queyang arrest, then requested Qi prison clerk Cao Jiu write to Queyang prison clerk Sima Xin, to use precedent got released. Xiang Liang killed person, with Ji avoided enmity in Wu Zhong. Wu Zhong worthy scholars all came out under Xiang Liang. Whenever Wu Zhong had great labor service or funerals, Xiang Liang often acted as main manager, secretly used military tactics to organize guests and younger brothers, with this knew his ability. Qin First Emperor toured Kuaiji, crossed Zhejiang, Liang with Ji both watched. Ji said: 'That can be taken and replaced.' Liang covered his mouth, said: 'Do not reckless speak, clan exterminated!' Liang with this considered Ji extraordinary. Ji grew eight chi plus, strength could lift tripod, talent spirit surpassed people, though Wu Zhong younger brothers all already feared Ji.

sentences.zh: 秦二世元年七月，陳涉等起大澤中。

translations.text: Qin Second Year first year seventh month, Chen She and others rose in Daze.

sentences.zh: 其九月，會稽守通謂梁曰：「江西皆反，此亦天亡秦之時也。

translations.text: Its ninth month, Kuaiji governor Tong told Liang said: 'Jiangxi all rebel, this also heaven perishing Qin time.

sentences.zh: 吾聞先即制人，後則為人所制。

translations.text: I heard first then control people, later then controlled by people.

sentences.zh: 吾欲發兵，使公及桓楚將。」

translations.text: I wish to send troops, make gong and Huan Chu lead.'

sentences.zh: 是時桓楚亡在澤中。

translations.text: At time Huan Chu fled in marshes.

sentences.zh: 梁曰：「桓楚亡，人莫知其處，獨籍知之耳。」

translations.text: Liang said: 'Huan Chu fled, people none know his place, only Ji knows.'

sentences.zh: 梁乃出，誡籍持劍居外待。

translations.text: Liang then left, warned Ji hold sword wait outside.

sentences.zh: 梁復入，與守坐，曰：「請召籍，使受命召桓楚。」

translations.text: Liang again entered, with governor sat, said: 'Please summon Ji, make receive command summon Huan Chu.'

sentences.zh: 守曰：「諾。」

translations.text: Governor said: 'Yes.'

sentences.zh: 梁召籍入。

translations.text: Liang summoned Ji enter.

sentences.zh: 須臾，梁眴籍曰：「可行矣！」

translations.text: Moment, Liang winked at Ji said: 'Can go!'

sentences.zh: 於是籍遂拔劍斬守頭。

translations.text: Thereupon Ji drew sword beheaded governor.

sentences.zh: 項梁持守頭，佩其印綬。

translations.text: Xiang Liang held governor head, wore his seal cords.

sentences.zh: 門下大驚，擾亂，籍所擊殺數十百人。

translations.text: Gate below greatly shocked, disturbed, Ji attacked killed several tens hundreds people.

sentences.zh: 一府中皆慴伏，莫敢起。

translations.text: One prefecture all terrified submitted, none dared rise.

sentences.zh: 梁乃召故所知豪吏，諭以所為起大事，遂舉吳中兵。

translations.text: Liang then summoned former known powerful officials, explained what did to rise great affair, then raised Wu Zhong troops.

sentences.zh: 使人收下縣，得精兵八千人。

translations.text: Sent people collected lower counties, got elite troops eight thousand.

sentences.zh: 梁部署吳中豪傑為校尉、候、司馬。

translations.text: Liang deployed Wu Zhong powerful men as colonel, scout, marshal.

sentences.zh: 有一人不得用，自言於梁。

translations.text: Had one person not used, personally spoke to Liang.

sentences.zh: 梁曰：「前時某喪使公主某事，不能辦，以此不任用公。」

translations.text: Liang said: 'Former time certain funeral made gong manage certain affair, could not manage, with this not appoint use gong.'

sentences.zh: 眾乃皆伏。

translations.text: Crowd then all submitted.

sentences.zh: 於是梁為會稽守，籍為裨將，徇下縣。

translations.text: Thereupon Liang as Kuaiji governor, Ji as deputy general, toured lower counties.

Qin Second Year first year seventh month, Chen She and others rose in Daze. Its ninth month, Kuaiji governor Tong told Liang said: 'Jiangxi all rebel, this also heaven perishing Qin time. I heard first then control people, later then controlled by people. I wish to send troops, make gong and Huan Chu lead.' At time Huan Chu fled in marshes. Liang said: 'Huan Chu fled, people none know his place, only Ji knows.' Liang then left, warned Ji hold sword wait outside. Liang again entered, with governor sat, said: 'Please summon Ji, make receive command summon Huan Chu.' Governor said: 'Yes.' Liang summoned Ji enter. Moment, Liang winked at Ji said: 'Can go!' Thereupon Ji drew sword beheaded governor. Xiang Liang held governor head, wore his seal cords. Gate below greatly shocked, disturbed, Ji attacked killed several tens hundreds people. One prefecture all terrified submitted, none dared rise. Liang then summoned former known powerful officials, explained what did to rise great affair, then raised Wu Zhong troops. Sent people collected lower counties, got elite troops eight thousand. Liang deployed Wu Zhong powerful men as colonel, scout, marshal. Had one person not used, personally spoke to Liang. Liang said: 'Former time certain funeral made gong manage certain affair, could not manage, with this not appoint use gong.' Crowd then all submitted. Thereupon Liang as Kuaiji governor, Ji as deputy general, toured lower counties.

sentences.zh: 廣陵人召平於是為陳王徇廣陵，未能下。

translations.text: Guangling person Zhao Ping then for Chen Wang toured Guangling, could not take.

sentences.zh: 聞陳王敗走，秦兵又且至，乃渡江矯陳王命，拜梁為楚王上柱國。

translations.text: Heard Chen Wang defeated fled, Qin troops moreover coming, then crossed Jiang falsely Chen Wang command, appointed Liang as Chu Wang upper pillar state.

sentences.zh: 曰：「江東已定，急引兵西擊秦。」

translations.text: Said: 'Jiangdong already settled, urgently lead troops west attack Qin.'

sentences.zh: 項梁乃以八千人渡江而西。

translations.text: Xiang Liang then with eight thousand crossed Jiang west.

sentences.zh: 聞陳嬰已下東陽，使使欲與連和俱西。

translations.text: Heard Chen Ying already took Dongyang, sent messenger wished connect harmonize together west.

sentences.zh: 陳嬰者，故東陽令史，居縣中，素信謹，稱為長者。

translations.text: Chen Ying was former Dongyang county clerk, resided county, always trustworthy careful, called elder.

sentences.zh: 東陽少年殺其令，相聚數千人，欲置長，無適用，乃請陳嬰。

translations.text: Dongyang youth killed their magistrate, gathered several thousand people, wished establish elder, none suitable, then requested Chen Ying.

sentences.zh: 嬰謝不能，遂彊立嬰為長，縣中從者得二萬人。

translations.text: Ying declined could not, then forced established Ying as elder, county followers got twenty thousand people.

sentences.zh: 少年欲立嬰便為王，異軍蒼頭特起。

translations.text: Youth wished establish Ying conveniently as wang, different army green head special rise.

sentences.zh: 陳嬰母謂嬰曰：「自我為汝家婦，未嘗聞汝先古之有貴者。

translations.text: Chen Ying mother told Ying said: 'From I became your family woman, never heard your ancestors had noble ones.

sentences.zh: 今暴得大名，不祥。

translations.text: Now violently obtained great name, not auspicious.

sentences.zh: 不如有所屬，事成猶得封侯，事敗易以亡，非世所指名也。」

translations.text: Better belong to someone, affair succeed still get enfeoff marquis, affair fail easy to flee, not world pointed name."

sentences.zh: 嬰乃不敢為王。

translations.text: Ying then dared not be wang.

sentences.zh: 謂其軍吏曰：「項氏世世將家，有名於楚。

translations.text: Told his army officials said: "Xiang clan generation generation general family, have name in Chu.

sentences.zh: 今欲舉大事，將非其人，不可。

translations.text: Now wish raise great affair, general not the person, cannot.

sentences.zh: 我倚名族，亡秦必矣。」

translations.text: I rely famous clan, perish Qin must."

sentences.zh: 於是眾從其言，以兵屬項梁。

translations.text: Thereupon crowd followed his words, with troops belonged Xiang Liang.

sentences.zh: 項梁渡淮，黥布、蒲將軍亦以兵屬焉。

translations.text: Xiang Liang crossed Huai, Qing Bu, Pu general also with troops belonged.

sentences.zh: 凡六七萬人，軍下邳。

translations.text: Altogether sixty seventy thousand people, army Xiapi.

Guangling person Zhao Ping then for Chen Wang toured Guangling, could not take. Heard Chen Wang defeated fled, Qin troops moreover coming, then crossed Jiang falsely Chen Wang command, appointed Liang as Chu Wang upper pillar state. Said: 'Jiangdong already settled, urgently lead troops west attack Qin.' Xiang Liang then with eight thousand crossed Jiang west. Heard Chen Ying already took Dongyang, sent messenger wished connect harmonize together west. Chen Ying was former Dongyang county clerk, resided county, always trustworthy careful, called elder. Dongyang youth killed their magistrate, gathered several thousand people, wished establish elder, none suitable, then requested Chen Ying. Ying declined could not, then forced established Ying as elder, county followers got twenty thousand people. Youth wished establish Ying conveniently as wang, different army green head special rise. Chen Ying mother told Ying said: 'From I became your family woman, never heard your ancestors had noble ones. Now violently obtained great name, not auspicious. Better belong to someone, affair succeed still get enfeoff marquis, affair fail easy to flee, not world pointed name." Ying then dared not be wang. Told his army officials said: "Xiang clan generation generation general family, have name in Chu. Now wish raise great affair, general not the person, cannot. I rely famous clan, perish Qin must." Thereupon crowd followed his words, with troops belonged Xiang Liang. Xiang Liang crossed Huai, Qing Bu, Pu general also with troops belonged. Altogether sixty seventy thousand people, army Xiapi.

sentences.zh: 當是時，秦嘉已立景駒為楚王，軍彭城東，欲距項梁。

translations.text: At this time, Qin Jia already established Jing Ju as Chu Wang, army Pengcheng east, wished resist Xiang Liang.

sentences.zh: 項梁謂軍吏曰：「陳王先首事，戰不利，未聞所在。

translations.text: Xiang Liang told army officials said: "Chen Wang first began affair, battle unfavorable, not heard location.

sentences.zh: 今秦嘉倍陳王而立景駒，逆無道。」

translations.text: Now Qin Jia betrayed Chen Wang established Jing Ju, rebellious without way."

sentences.zh: 乃進兵擊秦嘉。

translations.text: Then advanced troops attacked Qin Jia.

sentences.zh: 秦嘉軍敗走，追之至胡陵。

translations.text: Qin Jia army defeated fled, pursued to Hu Ling.

sentences.zh: 嘉還戰一日，嘉死，軍降。

translations.text: Jia returned battle one day, Jia died, army surrendered.

sentences.zh: 景駒走死梁地。

translations.text: Jing Ju fled died Liang land.

sentences.zh: 項梁已并秦嘉軍，軍胡陵，將引軍而西。

translations.text: Xiang Liang already united Qin Jia army, army Hu Ling, would lead army west.

sentences.zh: 章邯軍至栗，項梁使別將朱雞石、餘樊君與戰。

translations.text: Zhang An army arrived Li, Xiang Liang made separate general Zhu Ji Shi, Yu Fan Jun with battle.

sentences.zh: 餘樊君死。

translations.text: Yu Fan Jun died.

sentences.zh: 朱雞石軍敗，亡走胡陵。

translations.text: Zhu Ji Shi army defeated, fled Hu Ling.

sentences.zh: 項梁乃引兵入薛，誅雞石。

translations.text: Xiang Liang then led troops entered Xue, executed Ji Shi.

sentences.zh: 項梁前使項羽別攻襄城，襄城堅守不下。

translations.text: Xiang Liang previously made Xiang Yu separate attack Xiangcheng, Xiangcheng firmly defended not fell.

sentences.zh: 已拔，皆阬之。

translations.text: Already took, all pitted them.

sentences.zh: 還報項梁。

translations.text: Returned reported Xiang Liang.

sentences.zh: 項梁聞陳王定死，召諸別將會薛計事。

translations.text: Xiang Liang heard Chen Wang definitely died, summoned various separate generals assembled Xue planned affairs.

sentences.zh: 此時沛公亦起沛，往焉。

translations.text: At this time Pei Gong also rose Pei, went there.

At this time, Qin Jia already established Jing Ju as Chu Wang, army Pengcheng east, wished resist Xiang Liang. Xiang Liang told army officials said: "Chen Wang first began affair, battle unfavorable, not heard location. Now Qin Jia betrayed Chen Wang established Jing Ju, rebellious without way." Then advanced troops attacked Qin Jia. Qin Jia army defeated fled, pursued to Hu Ling. Jia returned battle one day, Jia died, army surrendered. Jing Ju fled died Liang land. Xiang Liang already united Qin Jia army, army Hu Ling, would lead army west. Zhang An army arrived Li, Xiang Liang made separate general Zhu Ji Shi, Yu Fan Jun with battle. Yu Fan Jun died. Zhu Ji Shi army defeated, fled Hu Ling. Xiang Liang then led troops entered Xue, executed Ji Shi. Xiang Liang previously made Xiang Yu separate attack Xiangcheng, Xiangcheng firmly defended not fell. Already took, all pitted them. Returned reported Xiang Liang. Xiang Liang heard Chen Wang definitely died, summoned various separate generals assembled Xue planned affairs. At this time Pei Gong also rose Pei, went there.

sentences.zh: 居鄛人范增，年七十，素居家，好奇計，往說項梁曰：「陳勝敗碧當。

translations.text: Ju person Fan Zeng, aged seventy, always resided home, fond of wondrous plans, went persuaded Xiang Liang said: "Chen Sheng failed should.

sentences.zh: 夫秦滅六國，楚最無罪。

translations.text: Qin extinguished six states, Chu most without crime.

sentences.zh: 自懷王入秦不反，楚人憐之至今，故楚南公曰『楚雖三戶，亡秦必楚』也。

translations.text: From Huai Wang entered Qin not returned, Chu people pity him until now, therefore Chu south public said 'Chu though three households, perish Qin must Chu'.

sentences.zh: 今陳勝首事，不立楚後而自立，其勢不長。

translations.text: Now Chen Sheng first began, not establish Chu successor but self-established, his momentum not long.

sentences.zh: 今君起江東，楚蜂午之將皆爭附君者，以君世世楚將，為能復立楚之後也。」

translations.text: Now jun rise Jiangdong, Chu hornet noon generals all contend attach jun, because jun generation generation Chu general, able to again establish Chu successor."

sentences.zh: 於是項梁然其言，乃求楚懷王孫心民閒，為人牧羊，立以為楚懷王，從民所望也。

translations.text: Thereupon Xiang Liang approved his words, sought Chu Huai Wang grandson Xin among people, was shepherding sheep, established as Chu Huai Wang, from people desired.

sentences.zh: 陳嬰為楚上柱國，封五縣，與懷王都盱臺。

translations.text: Chen Ying as Chu upper pillar state, enfeoffed five counties, with Huai Wang capital Xu Tai.

sentences.zh: 項梁自號為武信君。

translations.text: Xiang Liang self-styled as Wu Xin Jun.

Ju person Fan Zeng, aged seventy, always resided home, fond of wondrous plans, went persuaded Xiang Liang said: "Chen Sheng failed should. Qin extinguished six states, Chu most without crime. From Huai Wang entered Qin not returned, Chu people pity him until now, therefore Chu south public said 'Chu though three households, perish Qin must Chu'. Now Chen Sheng first began, not establish Chu successor but self-established, his momentum not long. Now jun rise Jiangdong, Chu hornet noon generals all contend attach jun, because jun generation generation Chu general, able to again establish Chu successor." Thereupon Xiang Liang approved his words, sought Chu Huai Wang grandson Xin among people, was shepherding sheep, established as Chu Huai Wang, from people desired. Chen Ying as Chu upper pillar state, enfeoffed five counties, with Huai Wang capital Xu Tai. Xiang Liang self-styled as Wu Xin Jun.

sentences.zh: 居數月，引兵攻亢父，與齊田榮、司馬龍且軍救東阿，大破秦軍於東阿。

translations.text: Resided several months, led troops attacked Kang Fu, with Qi Tian Rong, Si Ma Long Ju army saved Dong E, greatly defeated Qin army at Dong E.

sentences.zh: 田榮即引兵歸，逐其王假。

translations.text: Tian Rong then led troops returned, drove his wang Jia.

sentences.zh: 假亡走楚。

translations.text: Jia fled Chu.

sentences.zh: 假相田角亡走趙。

translations.text: Jia chancellor Tian Jiao fled Zhao.

sentences.zh: 角弟田閒故齊將，居趙不敢歸。

translations.text: Jiao younger brother Tian Jian former Qi general, resided Zhao dared not return.

sentences.zh: 田榮立田儋子市為齊王。

translations.text: Tian Rong established Tian Dan son Shi as Qi Wang.

sentences.zh: 項梁已破東阿下軍，遂追秦軍。

translations.text: Xiang Liang already defeated Dong E lowered army, then pursued Qin army.

sentences.zh: 數使使趣齊兵，欲與俱西。

translations.text: Several sent messengers urged Qi troops, wished with together west.

sentences.zh: 田榮曰：「楚殺田假，趙殺田角、田閒，乃發兵。」

translations.text: Tian Rong said: "Chu kill Tian Jia, Zhao kill Tian Jiao, Tian Jian, then send troops."

sentences.zh: 項梁曰：「田假為與國之王，窮來從我，不忍殺之。」

translations.text: Xiang Liang said: "Tian Jia was allied state wang, poor came follow me, not bear kill him."

sentences.zh: 趙亦不殺田角、田閒以市於齊。

translations.text: Zhao also not kill Tian Jiao, Tian Jian to trade with Qi.

sentences.zh: 齊遂不肯發兵助楚。

translations.text: Qi then unwilling send troops help Chu.

sentences.zh: 項梁使沛公及項羽別攻城陽，屠之。

translations.text: Xiang Liang made Pei Gong and Xiang Yu separate attack Chengyang, slaughtered it.

sentences.zh: 西破秦軍濮陽東，秦兵收入濮陽。

translations.text: West defeated Qin army Puyang east, Qin troops withdrew into Puyang.

sentences.zh: 沛公、項羽乃攻定陶。

translations.text: Pei Gong, Xiang Yu then attacked Dingtao.

sentences.zh: 定陶未下，去，西略地至雝丘，大破秦軍，斬李由。

translations.text: Dingtao not fallen, departed, west plundered land to Chongqiu, greatly defeated Qin army, beheaded Li You.

sentences.zh: 還攻外黃，外黃未下。

translations.text: Returned attacked Waihuang, Waihuang not fallen.

Resided several months, led troops attacked Kang Fu, with Qi Tian Rong, Si Ma Long Ju army saved Dong E, greatly defeated Qin army at Dong E. Tian Rong then led troops returned, drove his wang Jia. Jia fled Chu. Jia chancellor Tian Jiao fled Zhao. Jiao younger brother Tian Jian former Qi general, resided Zhao dared not return. Tian Rong established Tian Dan son Shi as Qi Wang. Xiang Liang already defeated Dong E lowered army, then pursued Qin army. Several sent messengers urged Qi troops, wished with together west. Tian Rong said: "Chu kill Tian Jia, Zhao kill Tian Jiao, Tian Jian, then send troops." Xiang Liang said: "Tian Jia was allied state wang, poor came follow me, not bear kill him." Zhao also not kill Tian Jiao, Tian Jian to trade with Qi. Qi then unwilling send troops help Chu. Xiang Liang made Pei Gong and Xiang Yu separate attack Chengyang, slaughtered it. West defeated Qin army Puyang east, Qin troops withdrew into Puyang. Pei Gong, Xiang Yu then attacked Dingtao. Dingtao not fallen, departed, west plundered land to Chongqiu, greatly defeated Qin army, beheaded Li You. Returned attacked Waihuang, Waihuang not fallen.

sentences.zh: 項梁起東阿，西，（北）［比］至定陶，再破秦軍，項羽等又斬李由，益輕秦，有驕色。

translations.text: Xiang Liang rose Dong E, west, arrived Dingtao, again defeated Qin army, Xiang Yu and others moreover beheaded Li You, increasingly despised Qin, had arrogant appearance.

sentences.zh: 宋義乃諫項梁曰：「戰勝而將驕卒惰者敗。

translations.text: Song Yi then admonished Xiang Liang said: "Battle victorious and general arrogant troops lazy then defeated.

sentences.zh: 今卒少惰矣，秦兵日益，臣為君畏之。」

translations.text: Gong for me offer them." Zhang Liang said: "Careful yes."

sentences.zh: 當是時，項王軍在鴻門下，沛公軍在霸上，相去四十里。

translations.text: At this time, Xiang Wang army at Hong Men below, Pei Gong army at Ba Shang, mutually separated forty li.

sentences.zh: 沛公則置車騎，脫身獨騎，與樊噲、夏侯嬰、靳彊、紀信等四人持劍盾步走，從酈山下，道芷陽閒行。

translations.text: Pei Gong then abandoned chariots riders, escaped body alone rode, with Fan Kuai, Xia Hou Ying, Jin Qiang, Ji Xin and others four people held swords shields foot walked, from Li Shan below, road Zhi Yang between walked.

sentences.zh: 沛公謂張良曰：「從此道至吾軍，不過二十里耳。

translations.text: Pei Gong told Zhang Liang said: "From this road to my army, not over twenty li.

sentences.zh: 度我至軍中，公乃入。」

translations.text: Measure I arrive army midst, gong then enter."

sentences.zh: 沛公已去，閒至軍中，張良入謝，曰：「沛公不勝桮杓，不能辭。

translations.text: Pei Gong already departed, between arrived army midst, Zhang Liang entered thanked, said: "Pei Gong not win cup ladle, cannot apologize.

sentences.zh: 謹使臣良奉白璧一雙，再拜獻大王足下；

translations.text: He has respectfully sent me, Liang, with a pair of white jade disks, to bow twice and present them at the great king's feet;

sentences.zh: 玉斗一雙，再拜奉大將軍足下。」

translations.text: and a pair of jade dippers, to bow twice and offer them at the Supreme General's feet."

sentences.zh: 項王曰：「沛公安在？」

translations.text: King Xiang said: "Where is Pei Gong?"

sentences.zh: 良曰：「聞大王有意督過之，脫身獨去，已至軍矣。」

translations.text: Liang said: "Hearing the great king intended to reproach and censure him, he escaped alone and has already reached his army."

sentences.zh: 項王則受璧，置之坐上。

translations.text: King Xiang then accepted the disks and placed them on his seat.

sentences.zh: 亞父受玉斗，置之地，拔劍撞而破之，曰：「唉！

translations.text: The Second Father accepted the jade dippers, placed them on the ground, drew his sword, struck and shattered them, saying: "Alas!

sentences.zh: 豎子不足與謀。

translations.text: This youngster is not worth plotting with.

sentences.zh: 奪項王天下者，必沛公也，吾屬今為之虜矣。」

translations.text: He who seizes all under Heaven from King Xiang will certainly be Pei Gong; we will now become his captives."

sentences.zh: 沛公至軍，立誅殺曹無傷。

translations.text: When Pei Gong reached his army, he immediately executed Cao Wushang.

Pei Gong already left, Xiang Wang made colonel Chen Ping summon Pei Gong. Pei Gong said: "Now leave, not apologized, do it what?" Fan Kuai said: "Great action not care fine careful, great ritual not decline small yield. Like now person just for knife chopping block, I for fish meat, what decline." Thereupon departed. Then ordered Zhang Liang stay thank. Liang asked said: "Da wang come what hold?" Said: "I hold white jade one pair, wished offer Xiang Wang, jade dou one pair, wished give Ya Fu, met his anger, dared not offer. Gong for me offer them." Zhang Liang said: "Careful yes." At this time, Xiang Wang army at Hong Men below, Pei Gong army at Ba Shang, mutually separated forty li. Pei Gong then abandoned chariots riders, escaped body alone rode, with Fan Kuai, Xia Hou Ying, Jin Qiang, Ji Xin and others four people held swords shields foot walked, from Li Shan below, road Zhi Yang between walked. Pei Gong told Zhang Liang said: "From this road to my army, not over twenty li. Measure I arrive army midst, gong then enter." Pei Gong already departed, between arrived army midst, Zhang Liang entered thanked, said: "Pei Gong not win cup ladle, cannot apologize. He has respectfully sent me, Liang, with a pair of white jade disks, to bow twice and present them at the great king's feet; and a pair of jade dippers, to bow twice and offer them at the Supreme General's feet." King Xiang said: "Where is Pei Gong?" Liang said: "Hearing the great king intended to reproach and censure him, he escaped alone and has already reached his army." King Xiang then accepted the disks and placed them on his seat. The Second Father accepted the jade dippers, placed them on the ground, drew his sword, struck and shattered them, saying: "Alas! This youngster is not worth plotting with. He who seizes all under Heaven from King Xiang will certainly be Pei Gong; we will now become his captives." When Pei Gong reached his army, he immediately executed Cao Wushang.

sentences.zh: 居數日，項羽引兵西屠咸陽，殺秦降王子嬰，燒秦宮室，火三月不滅；

translations.text: After several days, Xiang Yu led his troops west, massacred Xianyang, killed the surrendered King of Qin, Ziying, burned the Qin palace chambers—the fire did not go out for three months;

sentences.zh: 收其貨寶婦女而東。

translations.text: collected their wealth, treasures, and women, and went east.

sentences.zh: 人或說項王曰：「關中阻山河四塞，地肥饒，可都以霸。」

translations.text: Someone persuaded King Xiang, saying: "Guanzhong is protected by mountains and rivers on four sides; the land is fertile and rich—you could make it your capital to establish hegemony."

sentences.zh: 項王見秦宮皆以燒殘破，又心懷思欲東歸，曰：「富貴不歸故鄉，如衣繡夜行，誰知之者！」

translations.text: King Xiang saw that the Qin palaces had all been burned and ruined, and in his heart he longed to return east, saying: "Wealth and honor without returning to one's native place is like wearing embroidered robes at night—who would know it!"

sentences.zh: 說者曰：「人言楚人沐猴而冠耳，果然。」

translations.text: The persuader said: "People say the Chu are macaques wearing caps—it turns out to be true."

sentences.zh: 項王聞之，烹說者。

translations.text: King Xiang, hearing this, boiled the persuader alive.

After several days, Xiang Yu led his troops west, massacred Xianyang, killed the surrendered King of Qin, Ziying, burned the Qin palace chambers—the fire did not go out for three months; collected their wealth, treasures, and women, and went east. Someone persuaded King Xiang, saying: "Guanzhong is protected by mountains and rivers on four sides; the land is fertile and rich—you could make it your capital to establish hegemony." King Xiang saw that the Qin palaces had all been burned and ruined, and in his heart he longed to return east, saying: "Wealth and honor without returning to one's native place is like wearing embroidered robes at night—who would know it!" The persuader said: "People say the Chu are macaques wearing caps—it turns out to be true." King Xiang, hearing this, boiled the persuader alive.

sentences.zh: 項王使人致命懷王。

translations.text: King Xiang sent men to present orders to King Huai.

sentences.zh: 懷王曰：「如約。」

translations.text: King Huai said: "According to the agreement."

sentences.zh: 乃尊懷王為義帝。

translations.text: They then honored King Huai as the Righteous Emperor.

sentences.zh: 項王欲自王，先王諸將相。

translations.text: King Xiang wished to make himself king and first made the generals and ministers kings.

sentences.zh: 謂曰：「天下初發難時，假立諸侯後以伐秦。

translations.text: He said: "When all under Heaven first raised difficulties, we provisionally installed descendants of feudal lords to attack Qin.

sentences.zh: 然身被堅執銳首事，暴露於野三年，滅秦定天下者，皆將相諸君與籍之力也。

translations.text: Yet I personally wore armor and wielded sharp weapons to initiate affairs, exposed in the wilderness for three years; those who destroyed Qin and settled all under Heaven were all you generals, ministers, and lords together with Ji's strength.

sentences.zh: 義帝雖無功，故當分其地而王之。」

translations.text: Though the Righteous Emperor had no achievements, he should still be given his share of territory to rule."

sentences.zh: 諸將皆曰：「善。」

translations.text: All the generals said: "Excellent."

sentences.zh: 乃分天下，立諸將為侯王。

translations.text: He then divided all under Heaven and installed the generals as marquis-kings.

sentences.zh: 項王、范增疑沛公之有天下，業已講解，又惡負約，恐諸侯叛之，乃陰謀曰：「巴、蜀道險，秦之遷人皆居蜀。」

translations.text: King Xiang and Fan Zeng suspected Pei Gong of having designs on all under Heaven; affairs had already been reconciled, yet they were reluctant to break the agreement and feared the feudal lords would rebel; so they secretly plotted, saying: "The roads of Ba and Shu are treacherous; the Qin people who were exiled all reside in Shu."

sentences.zh: 乃曰：「巴、蜀亦關中地也。」

translations.text: They then said: "Ba and Shu are also Guanzhong territory."

sentences.zh: 故立沛公為漢王，王巴、蜀、漢中，都南鄭。

translations.text: Therefore they installed Pei Gong as King of Han, to rule Ba, Shu, and Hanzhong, with his capital at Nanzheng.

sentences.zh: 而三分關中，王秦降將以距塞漢王。

translations.text: They divided Guanzhong into three parts, making kings of the surrendered Qin generals to block the King of Han.

sentences.zh: 項王乃立章邯為雍王，王咸陽以西，都廢丘。

translations.text: King Xiang then installed Zhang Han as King of Yong, ruling west of Xianyang, with his capital at Feiqiu.

sentences.zh: 長史欣者，故為櫟陽獄掾，嘗有德於項梁；

translations.text: Chief Clerk Xin had formerly been a prison clerk at Liyang and once had shown kindness to Xiang Liang;

sentences.zh: 都尉董翳者，本勸章邯降楚。

translations.text: Commandant Dong Yi had originally urged Zhang Han to surrender to Chu.

sentences.zh: 故立司馬欣為塞王，王咸陽以東至河，都櫟陽；

translations.text: Therefore he installed Sima Xin as King of Sai, ruling from east of Xianyang to the Yellow River, with his capital at Liyang;

sentences.zh: 立董翳為翟王，王上郡，都高奴。

translations.text: installed Dong Yi as King of Di, ruling Shangjun, with his capital at Gaonu.

sentences.zh: 徙魏王豹為西魏王，王河東，都平陽。

translations.text: He moved King Bao of Wei to be King of Western Wei, ruling Hedong, with his capital at Pingyang.

sentences.zh: 瑕丘申陽者，張耳嬖臣也，先下河南（郡），迎楚河上，故立申陽為河南王，都雒陽。

translations.text: Shen Yang of Xiaqiu was a favorite minister of Zhang Er; he had first taken Henan Commandery and welcomed Chu at the Yellow River, so they installed Shen Yang as King of Henan, with his capital at Luoyang.

sentences.zh: 韓王成因故都，都陽翟。

translations.text: King Cheng of Han retained his former capital, with his capital at Yangzhai.

sentences.zh: 趙將司馬卬定河內，數有功，故立卬為殷王，王河內，都朝歌。

translations.text: Zhao general Sima Ang had pacified Henei and repeatedly achieved merit, so they installed Ang as King of Yin, ruling Henei, with his capital at Chaoge.

sentences.zh: 徙趙王歇為代王。

translations.text: They moved King Xie of Zhao to be King of Dai.

sentences.zh: 趙相張耳素賢，又從入關，故立耳為常山王，王趙地，都襄國。

translations.text: Zhao's Prime Minister Zhang Er had always been worthy and also followed them into the passes, so they installed Er as King of Changshan, ruling Zhao territory, with his capital at Xiangguo.

sentences.zh: 當陽君黥布為楚將，常冠軍，故立布為九江王，都六。

translations.text: Lord Dangyang Qing Bu as Chu general had always been foremost, so they installed Bu as King of Jiujiang, with his capital at Liu.

sentences.zh: 鄱君吳芮率百越佐諸侯，又從入關，故立芮為衡山王，都邾。

translations.text: Lord Po Wu Rui led the Hundred Yue to assist the feudal lords and also followed them into the passes, so they installed Rui as King of Hengshan, with his capital at Zhu.

sentences.zh: 義帝柱國共敖將兵擊南郡，功多，因立敖為臨江王，都江陵。

translations.text: The Righteous Emperor's Supreme Pillar of State Gong Ao led troops to attack Nanjun with many achievements, so they installed Ao as King of Linjiang, with his capital at Jiangling.

sentences.zh: 徙燕王韓廣為遼東王。

translations.text: They moved King Han Guang of Yan to be King of Liaodong.

sentences.zh: 燕將臧荼從楚救趙，因從入關，故立荼為燕王，都薊。

translations.text: Yan general Zang Tu followed Chu to rescue Zhao and consequently followed them into the passes, so they installed Tu as King of Yan, with his capital at Ji.

sentences.zh: 徙齊王田市為膠東王。

translations.text: They moved King Tian Shi of Qi to be King of Jiaodong.

sentences.zh: 齊將田都從共救趙，因從入關，故立都為齊王，都臨菑。

translations.text: Qi general Tian Du followed together to rescue Zhao and consequently followed them into the passes, so they installed Du as King of Qi, with his capital at Linzi.

sentences.zh: 故秦所滅齊王建孫田安，項羽方渡河救趙，田安下濟北數城，引其兵降項羽，故立安為濟北王，都博陽。

translations.text: Tian An, grandson of King Jian of Qi whom Qin had destroyed—when Xiang Yu was crossing the Yellow River to rescue Zhao, Tian An took several cities in Jibei and led his troops to surrender to Xiang Yu, so they installed An as King of Jibei, with his capital at Boyang.

sentences.zh: 田榮者，數負項梁，又不肯將兵從楚擊秦，以故不封。

translations.text: Thus the feudal lords were all enfeoffed; they all went to their states.

sentences.zh: 成安君陳餘棄將印去，不從入關，然素聞其賢，有功於趙，聞其在南皮，故因環封三縣。

translations.text: Chen Yu abandoned his general seal and left, not following into the pass, but because he was known for his virtue and had merit with Zhao, and was heard to be at Nanpi, therefore he was enfeoffed with three counties in a circle.

sentences.zh: 番君將梅鋗功多，故封十萬戶侯。

translations.text: In the tenth month, King Xiang of Chu left Xiang Yu to go to Pengcheng, killed Tian An of Jibei, made his state part of Chu.

sentences.zh: 項王自立為西楚霸王，王九郡，都彭城。

translations.text: In the first month, he made an announcement saying: "The Righteous Emperor has no descendants."

King Xiang sent men to present orders to King Huai. King Huai said: "According to the agreement." They then honored King Huai as the Righteous Emperor. King Xiang wished to make himself king and first made the generals and ministers kings. He said: "When all under Heaven first raised difficulties, we provisionally installed descendants of feudal lords to attack Qin. Yet I personally wore armor and wielded sharp weapons to initiate affairs, exposed in the wilderness for three years; those who destroyed Qin and settled all under Heaven were all you generals, ministers, and lords together with Ji's strength. Though the Righteous Emperor had no achievements, he should still be given his share of territory to rule." All the generals said: "Excellent." He then divided all under Heaven and installed the generals as marquis-kings. King Xiang and Fan Zeng suspected Pei Gong of having designs on all under Heaven; affairs had already been reconciled, yet they were reluctant to break the agreement and feared the feudal lords would rebel; so they secretly plotted, saying: "The roads of Ba and Shu are treacherous; the Qin people who were exiled all reside in Shu." They then said: "Ba and Shu are also Guanzhong territory." Therefore they installed Pei Gong as King of Han, to rule Ba, Shu, and Hanzhong, with his capital at Nanzheng. They divided Guanzhong into three parts, making kings of the surrendered Qin generals to block the King of Han. King Xiang then installed Zhang Han as King of Yong, ruling west of Xianyang, with his capital at Feiqiu. Chief Clerk Xin had formerly been a prison clerk at Liyang and once had shown kindness to Xiang Liang; Commandant Dong Yi had originally urged Zhang Han to surrender to Chu. Therefore he installed Sima Xin as King of Sai, ruling from east of Xianyang to the Yellow River, with his capital at Liyang; installed Dong Yi as King of Di, ruling Shangjun, with his capital at Gaonu. He moved King Bao of Wei to be King of Western Wei, ruling Hedong, with his capital at Pingyang. Shen Yang of Xiaqiu was a favorite minister of Zhang Er; he had first taken Henan Commandery and welcomed Chu at the Yellow River, so they installed Shen Yang as King of Henan, with his capital at Luoyang. King Cheng of Han retained his former capital, with his capital at Yangzhai. Zhao general Sima Ang had pacified Henei and repeatedly achieved merit, so they installed Ang as King of Yin, ruling Henei, with his capital at Chaoge. They moved King Xie of Zhao to be King of Dai. Zhao's Prime Minister Zhang Er had always been worthy and also followed them into the passes, so they installed Er as King of Changshan, ruling Zhao territory, with his capital at Xiangguo. Lord Dangyang Qing Bu as Chu general had always been foremost, so they installed Bu as King of Jiujiang, with his capital at Liu. Lord Po Wu Rui led the Hundred Yue to assist the feudal lords and also followed them into the passes, so they installed Rui as King of Hengshan, with his capital at Zhu. The Righteous Emperor's Supreme Pillar of State Gong Ao led troops to attack Nanjun with many achievements, so they installed Ao as King of Linjiang, with his capital at Jiangling. They moved King Han Guang of Yan to be King of Liaodong. Yan general Zang Tu followed Chu to rescue Zhao and consequently followed them into the passes, so they installed Tu as King of Yan, with his capital at Ji. They moved King Tian Shi of Qi to be King of Jiaodong. Qi general Tian Du followed together to rescue Zhao and consequently followed them into the passes, so they installed Du as King of Qi, with his capital at Linzi. Tian An, grandson of King Jian of Qi whom Qin had destroyed—when Xiang Yu was crossing the Yellow River to rescue Zhao, Tian An took several cities in Jibei and led his troops to surrender to Xiang Yu, so they installed An as King of Jibei, with his capital at Boyang. Thus the feudal lords were all enfeoffed; they all went to their states. King Huai of Chu, the Righteous Emperor, was without territory. In the tenth month, King Xiang of Chu left Xiang Yu to go to Pengcheng, killed Tian An of Jibei, made his state part of Chu. In the first month, he made an announcement saying: "The Righteous Emperor has no descendants."

sentences.zh: 漢之元年四月，諸侯罷戲下，各就國。

translations.text: He secretly ordered the kings of Hengshan and Linjiang to attack and kill the Righteous Emperor at Jiangzhong.

sentences.zh: 項王出之國，使人徙義帝，曰：「古之帝者地方千里，必居上游。」

translations.text: The King of Han heard that the Righteous Emperor had been killed, then mourned for him.

sentences.zh: 乃使使徙義帝長沙郴縣。

translations.text: Then he sent envoys to move the Righteous Emperor to Chenzhou in Changsha.

sentences.zh: 趣義帝行，其群臣稍稍背叛之，乃陰令衡山、臨江王擊殺之江中。

translations.text: In the second month, the King of Han from his fief in Nanzheng went out and took his kingdom; the subordinate counties in the territory of Ba and Shu rallied to him.

sentences.zh: 韓王成無軍功，項王不使之國，與俱至彭城，廢以為侯，已又殺之。

translations.text: In the third month, he crossed Lin Jin in the north.

sentences.zh: 臧荼之國，因逐韓廣之遼東，廣弗聽，荼擊殺廣無終，

translations.text: In the fourth month, he reached Chencang, fixed roads and repaired bridges, blocked the old passage by burning.

He secretly ordered the kings of Hengshan and Linjiang to attack and kill the Righteous Emperor at Jiangzhong. The King of Han heard that the Righteous Emperor had been killed, then mourned for him. When the feudal lords heard that the King of Han mourned the Righteous Emperor, they mostly rebelled against Chu and pledged allegiance to Han; the land of Qi and Zhao revolted several times. In the second month, the King of Han from his fief in Nanzheng went out and took his kingdom; the subordinate counties in the territory of Ba and Shu rallied to him. In the third month, he crossed Lin Jin in the north. In the fourth month, he reached Chencang, fixed roads and repaired bridges, blocked the old passage by burning.

sentences.zh: 田榮聞項羽徙齊王市膠東，而立齊將田都為齊王，乃大怒，不肯遣齊王之膠東，因以齊反，迎擊田都。

translations.text: Tian Rong heard that Xiang Yu moved Qi King Tian Shi to Jiaodong and established Qi general Tian Du as Qi King, greatly angered, refused to send Qi King to Jiaodong, because of this Qi rebelled, welcomed and attacked Tian Du.

sentences.zh: 田都走楚。

translations.text: Tian Du fled to Chu.

sentences.zh: 齊王市畏項王，乃亡之膠東就國。

translations.text: He sent Marquis of Jiujiang to attack Han; also sent soldiers to surround the King of Yan and Marquis of Yangxia.

sentences.zh: 田榮怒，追擊殺之即墨。

translations.text: Marquis of Yangxia fled to Han.

sentences.zh: 榮因自立為齊王，而西殺擊濟北王田安，并王三齊。

translations.text: He sent others to persuade the King of Qi to rebel against Han, and the King of Qi rebelled against Han and allied with Chu.

sentences.zh: 榮與彭越將軍印，令反梁地。

translations.text: King Xiang himself marched east to strike Qi.

sentences.zh: 陳餘陰使張同、夏說說齊王田榮曰：「項羽為天下宰，不平。

translations.text: He reached Chenyi where he heard that the King of Han had already occupied the three parts of Guanzhong and would attack Chu; King Xiang then returned to lead his troops north, killing Tian Rong.

sentences.zh: 今盡王故王於醜地，而王其群臣諸將善地，逐其故主趙王，乃北居代，餘以為不可。

translations.text: The King of Han went out to lead his troops to seize Pengcheng; King Xiang heard this and led his troops back to defeat the King of Han at Pengcheng, beheaded Marquis of Jiujiang, and the King of Han fled.

sentences.zh: 聞大王起兵，且不聽不義，願大王資餘兵，請以擊常山，以復趙王，請以國為捍蔽。」

translations.text: King Xiang then went north to strike the lands of Qi; all of Qi revolted to follow Tian Rong's younger brother Tian Heng as king.

sentences.zh: 齊王許之，因遣兵之趙。

translations.text: Qi King promised it, then sent troops to Zhao.

sentences.zh: 陳餘悉發三縣兵，與齊并力擊常山，大破之。

translations.text: In the fourth month of the third year of Han, King Xiang heard that the King of Han had occupied Pengcheng; King Xiang was then in Qi, riding day and night from Qi, engaging the Han army at Lu.

sentences.zh: 張耳走歸漢。

translations.text: Zhang Er fled and returned to Han.

sentences.zh: 陳餘迎故趙王歇於代，反之趙。

translations.text: In the fourth month of that year, King Xiang went west through Lingbi, striking the troops of Han and the feudal lords, defeating them; Liang and Chu were pacified.

sentences.zh: 趙王因立陳餘為代王。

translations.text: The King of Han fled north, crossing the Sui River.

King Xiang sent troops to block the Triple Pass; none could pass through. In the fifth month, King Han pacified the Three Qins; King Xiang heard this and was greatly enraged. He sent Marquis of Jiujiang to attack Han; also sent soldiers to surround the King of Yan and Marquis of Yangxia. Marquis of Yangxia fled to Han. He sent others to persuade the King of Qi to rebel against Han, and the King of Qi rebelled against Han and allied with Chu. King Xiang himself marched east to strike Qi. He reached Chenyi where he heard that the King of Han had already occupied the three parts of Guanzhong and would attack Chu; King Xiang then returned to lead his troops north, killing Tian Rong. The King of Han went out to lead his troops to seize Pengcheng; King Xiang heard this and led his troops back to defeat the King of Han at Pengcheng, beheaded Marquis of Jiujiang, and the King of Han fled. King Xiang then went north to strike the lands of Qi; all of Qi revolted to follow Tian Rong's younger brother Tian Heng as king. The King of Han gained possession of Lu, Liang, Chu, and Zhao, and sent envoys respectfully inviting the kings of the feudal lords to attack Chu together. In the fourth month of the third year of Han, King Xiang heard that the King of Han had occupied Pengcheng; King Xiang was then in Qi, riding day and night from Qi, engaging the Han army at Lu. The Han army had many soldiers, tens of thousands of people, and blocked the water's edge; the King of Chu constantly selected elite cavalry of three thousand, the Han army was completely defeated. In the fourth month of that year, King Xiang went west through Lingbi, striking the troops of Han and the feudal lords, defeating them; Liang and Chu were pacified. The King of Han fled north, crossing the Sui River.
